intro: Mahurea duckei, commonly known as the duckei mahurea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
